intro: Bopusia scabra, commonly known as the rough bopusia, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of South America. It is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf structures and often edible species.
